title: Donald Trump's historic first week in office
shortDescription: President Donald Trump has used his presidential power in record speed since taking office.

title: Pete Hegseth pledges to support President Trump
shortDescription: Secretary Pete Hegseth said the Defense Department will support "mass deportations in support of the president's objective."

title: Trump to ban DEI in military, reinstate troops who refused COVID shots
shortDescription: Trump's executive orders for the Pentagon will fulfill campaign promises that the Republican reiterated during last week's inaugural address.

title: President Trump backs off tariffs for Colombia
shortDescription: Colombia said they would accept deportation flights carrying Colombian migrants after the Trump administration threatened to impose tariffs.

title: Trump to huddle with House GOP as Cabinet push continues: Live updates
shortDescription: Donald Trump will huddle with House Republicans at a GOP retreat on Monday. Keep up with live updates from the USA TODAY Network.

title: Trump resumes threat to denaturalize US citizens
shortDescription: Trump ordered his administration to devote resources to investigating naturalized US citizens

title: Trump holds off on Colombia tariffs after deal reached on deportations
shortDescription: President Donald Trump is holding off on imposing tariffs and sanctions on Colombia following an agreement on accepting deportation flights.

title: GOP lawmaker says Trump made 'a mistake' by pardoning some Jan. 6 defendants
shortDescription: Sen. Lindsey Graham said in an interview that he thinks it was a “mistake” for Trump to pardon those who committed violent acts on Jan. 6, 2021.

title: Trumps slaps Colombia with trade, travel restrictions
shortDescription: Mexico, Colombia and Brazil push back on Trump's deportation of migrants. He promises 25% tariffs, travel ban on Colombia.

title: Republican senators urge Trump to rethink stripping security from ex-officials
shortDescription: Two senior Republican senators urged President Donald Trump to rethink his decision to strip personal security from some former Trump administration officials, one of whom was the target of an alleged Iranian plot.

title: USA TODAY reporters offer inside look at Donald Trump's second inauguration
shortDescription: USA TODAY reporters covered the historic events. They were inside the Capitol, walking the streets, at the White House and immersed in the MAGA crowd.

title: Vance knocks Catholic organization for criticizing Trump immigration policy
shortDescription: JD Vance knocked the U.S. Conference of Catholic Bishops after the group criticized some of Donald Trump's immigration policies.

title: Donald Trump takes down DEI, historic civil rights law: 5 takeaways
shortDescription: While conservative activists praise these efforts as a return to meritocracy, left-leaning activists believe these actions threaten racial progress .

title: President Trump floats plan to 'just clean out' war-torn Gaza
shortDescription: President Trump called for Egypt and Jordan to accept additional Palestinian refugees while suggesting a plan to "just clean out" Gaza.

title: Oath Keepers' Stewart Rhodes, out of prison, appears at Trump rally
shortDescription: Stewart Rhodes, founder of Oath Keepers, showed up at President Donald Trump's rally in Las Vegas days after being released from prison.

title: Trump vows to deliver on 'no tax on tips'
shortDescription: "If you're a restaurant worker, a server, a valet, a bellhop, a bartender ... your tips will be 100% yours," Trump tells a crowd in Las Vegas.

title: Police arrest Florida man who allegedly threatened to kill Trump
shortDescription: A man in West Palm Beach, Florida has been arrested after being accused of making threats against President Trump, police say.

title: Trump's boundary-testing first week showed aggressive use of power
shortDescription: Trump pardoned Jan. 6 rioters and tried to overturn birthright citizenship in an aggressive first week that included deportations and firings.

title: Trump invited to give first address to Congress since inauguration
shortDescription: Speaker Mike Johnson to make his first address to a joint session of Congress of his second term on Tuesday, March 4

title: Inside Congress' first days of the new Donald Trump administration
shortDescription: Unlike eight years ago, Congress isn't shocked by the tumult of a Trump White House.
